Thank you. I think it looks good. I've started some system tests to see what impact this has on performance, will post link here once done. @bharatviswa504 do you know what the memory overhead might be when turning on bloom filters?
retest this please

@twbecker thanks for the PR. Can you please add a test that fails without this change?

So, in general we should keep variable names consistent (like key/valSerde) and change the docs (?)
Maybe we can change the variable names of join APIs: `otherStream -> sideInput`?

Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Thanks for the PR. Not sure I would call this a security hole. In a secure cluster, ACLs would be used to determine who can write to internal topics, right?

Having said that, if there is no good use case for allowing this, it may be a good idea to disallow it. It is technically a breaking change to the protocol, which means a KIP is required. @junrao, do you know why this was allowed in the first place?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/3975/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Added the test, @dguy. While you're looking at this would you mind looking at the comment I put in the JIRA? It seems wrong to me that the existing DB is reused when there is no checkpoint; should it not be deleted first in that case?

@twbecker this is the case for all state stores. But, yes they probably should be deleted. I'd raise it as a separate JIRA.

Looks like you need to rebase

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/3988/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).
Yes, i think so. Let's see what @mjsax has to say

system test passed: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/291/console. I don't necessarily see a perf improvement, but I'm not sure the tests are designed for showing off any improvement. @bharatviswa504 any suggestions on a good test/benchmark?
LGTM thanks
@guozhangwang I think we should backport to 0.10.2 as well

@ijuma I had missed the `group.initial.rebalance.delay.ms` change, which is probably the reason why the failures are occurring in the build. I was thinking of subsequent join requests rather than the first one, which need low timeouts to trigger throttling. I have changed the code to set `group.initial.rebalance.delay.ms=0` as well. Thanks.
Resolved the conflicts.

@ewencp @ijuma @hachikuji I have rebased this patch and have run system tests. All the tests passed except the 0.8.2.2 compatibility test where the flush does not exist. Will you have time to take a look at this patch and hopefully we can get it checked into 0.11.0? Thanks.

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Hmmm... Yes and no. I am not happy with either `otherStream` nor `sideInput`: assume a KStream-KStream-join -- both inputs are equally important -- there is nothing like a "side" input (sounds like auxiliary)... However, I don't have a better idea either atm... So if you think `sideInput` is better than `otherStream`, just go for it.
